meanings.definition: Of or relating to the South Pole or the region around it.
meanings.sent1: The penguins waddled through the icy antarctic landscape.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study the antarctic climate to understand global weather patterns.
meanings.sent3: The antarctic winds were so cold that even the snowmen shivered.
meanings.sent4: Her heart felt as frozen as the antarctic tundra after the breakup.
meanings.sent5: The explorer's tales of the antarctic adventure were filled with frosty details.

meanings.definition: The southernmost of the earth's seven continents.
meanings.sent1: Many animals in the antarctic have adapted to the extreme cold.
meanings.sent2: Explorers brave the harsh conditions of the antarctic to uncover its mysteries.
meanings.sent3: The antarctic is like a giant freezer at the bottom of the world.
meanings.sent4: In her dreams, she sailed across the antarctic on a ship made of ice.
meanings.sent5: The beauty of the antarctic landscape took his breath away.
